home.title: Gmail OAuth Proxy Server
home.subtitle: A secure Google OAuth proxy service implemented with Go and Gin framework

dualAuth.title: Dual Authentication
dualAuth.description: Supports both API Key and IP whitelist authentication mechanisms

flexibleAuth.title: Flexible Authorization
flexibleAuth.description: Can use API Key and IP whitelist individually or in combination

httpsEnforcement.title: HTTPS Enforcement
httpsEnforcement.description: Forces HTTPS protocol (except in development environment)

ipWhitelist.title: IP Whitelist
ipWhitelist.description: Supports CIDR format and individual IP address access control

logSanitization.title: Log Sanitization
logSanitization.description: Automatically sanitizes sensitive information like tokens, secrets, etc.

requestProxy.title: Request Proxy
requestProxy.description: Converts JSON requests to form-urlencoded format and forwards to Google OAuth API

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.step1: Download the latest release for your platform
quickStart.step2: Set your API key (optional, auto-generated if not set)
quickStart.step3: Start the server with default configuration
quickStart.step4: Your OAuth proxy is ready to use!

parameterEditor.title: Parameter Editor
parameterEditor.description: Configure your Gmail OAuth Proxy Server parameters visually and generate commands

form.apiKeyPlaceholder: Enter your API key (optional, auto-generated if empty)
form.ipWhitelistPlaceholder: Enter IP addresses or CIDR ranges, one per line

download.title: Download
download.description: Download pre-built binaries for your platform

footer.description: A secure Google OAuth proxy service
footer.copyright: © 2024 Gmail OAuth Proxy Server. Licensed under MIT License.
